{{Doomwiki|partial invisibility effect}}The '''fuzz''' effect, or '''partial invisibility''' effect, creates a shimmering translucency effect by replacing the [[actor]]'s pixels by darker versions of one of their neighbors. In addition to actors, [[decal]]s can also be drawn with the fuzz effect, by using the {{c|fuzzy}} keyword in [[DECALDEF]].
An accurate implementation of the fuzz effect in an [[OpenGL]] renderer is difficult. [[GZDoom]] provides different shaders to emulate the look, available through the {{CVAR|R|gl_fuzztype}} console variable accessible from the [[OpenGL preferences]] menu; with "shadow" as a backup option in case the hardware used does not support pixel shaders.
Actors with the {{c|Fuzzy}} or {{c|OptFuzzy}} {{Property|RenderStyle|render styles}} are displayed with the partial invisibility effect. However, those with the {{c|OptFuzzy}} render style can be displayed with a different method depending on the value of the {{CVAR|R|r_drawfuzz}} console variable, accessible through the [[display options]] menu. Alternatives to the fuzzy style include "translucent" and "shadow".
The gallery below shows one of the first {{Class|spectre}}s encountered with various settings in ZDoom and GZDoom. <gallery> File:Fuzz_Normal.png|The normal fuzz effect. File:Fuzz_Translucent.png|Translucent style. File:Fuzz_Shadow.png|Shadow style.
